item.title: Object.is in JavaScript
item.description: Object.is is a method introduced in ECMAScript 2015 (ES6) that determines whether two values are the same value. It’s a more precise comparison than the traditional == (loose equality) or === (strict equality) operators in JavaScript. Object.is aims to provide an accurate comparison algorithm, particularly useful for distinguishing between values like +0 and -0, and for correctly identifying NaN values, which traditional comparisons cannot. Syntax 1 Object.is(value1, value2); value1: The first value to compare.
